isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TURBOCHARGERS - REMOVAL AND REASSEMBLY - INSPECTION

svcsubproc.title: Pre-Disassembly Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Make the following checks and if the turbocharger meets these requirements, it can be considered satisfactory and reinstalled on the engine. If it does not meet the requirements, it must be replaced or rebuilt. (Refer to "Reconditioning").

step1.para: Stand the turbocharger on bench with shaft in a horizontal position.
Wheels must spin freely when turned by hand.

Clamp turbocharger mounting flange in a vise and position a dial indicator with a magnetic base on the frame of the vise. Place the tip of the indicator on the turbine end of the shaft ( Figure 2.13
).
Move the shaft back and forth by hand and record the readings.
If the reading exceeds the specifications, the turbocharger must be reconditioned.
Remove the protective cover from the oil drain port in the center housing.

Install a two-inch contact point extension on the dial indicator and position the indicator as shown in Figure 2.14
. The indicator contact point must contact the turbine shaft through the oil drain port in the center housing.

Check radial shaft movement by lifting the shaft up and then letting it down ( Figure 2.14
).

note.para: YOU MUST LIFT EVENLY WITH BOTH HANDS TO GET ACCURATE READINGS.

step1.para: If the readings exceed specifications, the turbocharger must be reconditioned.

figure.caption: Figure 2.14 Checking Radial Shaft Movement with Housing Installed.

step1.para: If the radial shaft movement is within specifications, but interference between the compressor housing and compressor wheel is suspected, proceed as follows:

step2.para:
Mark the compressor housing location to the back plate to aid reassembly. Refer to Figure 2.15
.
b. Remove the compressor housing mounting bolts and clamps (T04B - 3 clamps and T04E - 2 clamps) which secure the housing to the back plate.

Visually inspect the housing for any signs of wheel contact. Refer to Figure 2.16
.

note.para: CARE MUST BE TAKEN DURING THE HANDLING OF THE IMPELLER AND TURBINE WHEEL. BE VERY CAREFUL AND AVOID BENDING ANY BLADES. BENT BLADES MUST NEVER BE USED.

step1.para:
Install the dial indicator as outlined in Step 2 and recheck the radial shaft movement as outlined in Step 3 ( Figure 2.17
). If the readings exceed specifications, with the housing removed, the compressor wheel is contacting the compressor housing and reconditioning is required.

figure.caption: Figure 2.15 Mark Compressor to Back Plate Location.
Figure 2.17 Checking Radial Shaft Movement with Compressor Housing Removed.

step1.para: Remove the turbine housing as follows:

step2.para: Mark the turbine housing location to the center housing, to facilitate reassembly. Refer to Figure 2.18.
Remove the turbine housing mounting bolts and clamps (T04B - 3 clamps and T04E - 2 clamps), which secure the turbine and center housings.
Lift the center housing and core assembly from the turbine housing.

step1.para:
Visually inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Refer to Figure 2.19
. Replace as required.

note.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by:

para.emph: a. HIGH AIR INLET RESTRICTION - which allows oil to transfer from the turbocharger center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
b. EXCESSIVE OIL CONSUMPTION - resulting in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
c. ENGINE OVERFUELING - can result in excessive operating temperatures which can cause aluminum components to melt. Such deposits may be found on the turbine wheel if such a failure occurs.

step1.para: Visually inspect the turbine and compressor housings for evidence of wheel rubbing. Replace the housing(s) as required.

note.para: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO STRAIGHTEN BENT WHEEL BLADES.

step1.para: If the turbocharger passes all pre-disassembly inspections, reinstall on engine. (See "INSTALLATION", this section.) If one or more inspections are out of specification or visually unacceptable, follow the instructions in this section under "Reconditioning".

figure.caption: Figure 2.18 Mark Turbine to Center Housing.
